head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #6

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #6 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy on her passage to Sandusky in the month of July 1813.

At 5 AM hove up larboard tacks aboard, light airs at south & clear weather, at 6 starboard tacks aboard, at 7 see a boat coming round the east-end of put in bay Island suppose her to be a boat from Amherstburg loaded with bread for the Troops – at 9 she joins us, correct in our supposition – at noon both our Gun boats come along side, light airs at ENE larboard tacks aboard, pass Cunninghams Island, keep the lead a going from five to 7 fathom water – at 2 PM put about starboard tacks aboard shortened sail, the Ellen astern distant about a mile or two at 3 came too in 5 fathom water with the best bower about 1½ miles from the SW Side of the Bay[,] handed Sails & commenced unloading Guns & artillery[.] Several of our Canoes & boats in shore under weigh doubling the point of the Bay – at 4 the Genl & suit good on Shore, the Ellen joins, comes too about a ¼ of a mile from us[.] I several times applied to the Genl (previous to his departure) for instructions but could get no positive answer from him, the only one was that I should wait until the 2 Six pounders which were in the Gun boats should be sent off to me – the last of the boats go off to join the others, light breezes at ENE & pleasant weather cleared up the decks, at 8 PM set the watch with orders to give immeadiate notice on seeing any craft, or light[.]

Fore part of this day, light breezes at East & Clear pleasant weather, some men employed mending fore top gallant sail, & main topsail[.] I go on shore discover the crutch, Herse piece & part of a main boom belonging to a Vessel, the Ellens boat passes by for Sandusky river – return on board, about 3 PM heard a gun fire in the direction of Sandusky[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
